funcs.name: bzclose
funcs.desc: Closes the given bzip2 file pointer.

return.desc: Returns TRUE on success or FALSE on failure.

args.name: bz
args.desc: The file pointer. It must be valid and must point to a file successfully opened by bzopen().

funcs.name: bzopen
funcs.desc: bzopen() opens a bzip2 (.bz2) file for reading or writing.

return.desc: If the open fails, bzopen() returns FALSE, otherwise it returns a pointer to the newly opened file.

args.name: filename
args.desc: The name of the file to open.

args.name: mode
args.desc: Similar to the fopen() function, only 'r' (read) and 'w' (write) are supported. Everything else will cause bzopen to return FALSE.

funcs.name: bzread
funcs.desc:
bzread() reads from the given bzip2 file pointer.

Reading stops when length (uncompressed) bytes have been read or EOF is reached, whichever comes first.

return.desc: Returns the uncompressed data, or FALSE on error.

args.name: bz
args.desc: The file pointer. It must be valid and must point to a file successfully opened by bzopen().

args.name: length
args.desc: If not specified, bzread() will read 1024 (uncompressed) bytes at a time.

funcs.name: bzwrite
funcs.desc: bzwrite() writes a string into the given bzip2 file stream.

return.desc: Returns the number of bytes written, or FALSE on error.

args.name: bz
args.desc: The file pointer. It must be valid and must point to a file successfully opened by bzopen().

args.name: length
args.desc: If supplied, writing will stop after length (uncompressed) bytes have been written or the end of data is reached, whichever comes first.

funcs.name: bzflush
funcs.desc: Forces a write of all buffered bzip2 data for the file pointer bz.

return.desc: Returns TRUE on success or FALSE on failure.

args.name: bz
args.desc: The file pointer. It must be valid and must point to a file successfully opened by bzopen().

funcs.name: bzerrstr
funcs.desc: Gets the error string of any bzip2 error returned by the given file pointer.

return.desc: Returns a string containing the error message.

args.name: bz
args.desc: The file pointer. It must be valid and must point to a file successfully opened by bzopen().

funcs.name: bzerror
funcs.desc: Returns the error number and error string of any bzip2 error returned by the given file pointer.

return.desc: Returns an associative array, with the error code in the errno entry, and the error message in the errstr entry.

args.name: bz
args.desc: The file pointer. It must be valid and must point to a file successfully opened by bzopen().

funcs.name: bzerrno
funcs.desc: Returns the error number of any bzip2 error returned by the given file pointer.

return.desc: Returns the error number as an integer.

args.name: bz
args.desc: The file pointer. It must be valid and must point to a file successfully opened by bzopen().

funcs.name: bzcompress
funcs.desc: bzcompress() compresses the given string and returns it as bzip2 encoded data.

return.desc: The compressed string or number of error in case of error.

args.name: blocksize
args.desc: Specifies the blocksize used during compression and should be a number from 1 to 9 with 9 giving the best compression, but using more resources to do so.

args.name: workfactor
args.desc:
Controls how the compression phase behaves when presented with worst case, highly repetitive, input data. The value can be between 0 and 250 with 0 being a special case.

Regardless of the workfactor, the generated output is the same.

funcs.name: bzdecompress
funcs.desc: bzdecompress() decompresses the given string containing bzip2 encoded data.

return.desc: The decompressed string or number of error in case of error.
